input: Write a short biography of Date Narikuni.
output: Date Narikuni (born 1969) is a Japanese politician, serving in the House of Representatives for the Democratic Party of Japan. Narikuni studied law at Waseda University and worked as a lawyer before entering politics in 2007. He has been a member of the lower house since 2009, serving as the Secretary-General of the Democratic Party from 2011-2014. He worked at the Spanish royal opera in Madrid and in 1820 he was appointed maestro of the Imperial Chapel, where he wrote for the imperial family. He also served as a conductor at the Imperial Theater and helped develop a new genre of opera seria. Goetz's compositions, such as the ballet "Zar und Zimmermann" (1800), were popular in his time.

input: Write a short biography of Juan Nepomucino Goetz.
output: Juan Nepomucino Goetz (1886-1949) was an Argentine writer known for his dark, satirical stories set in Buenos Aires' marginalized slums. He wrote a dozen novels and collections of short stories, including _Los pobres también piensan_ (1935, "The Poor Also Think"), which earned him international recognition. In 1944, he was awarded the Cervantes Prize, Spain's highest literary honor. Goetz's work reflects his commitment to the underprivileged, with a focus on their daily struggles and the difficulties they face in overcoming them. He was also an accomplished playwright, and his works have been adapted for film, theater, and television. His literary legacy is still widely celebrated in Argentina and beyond.

input: Write a short biography of Juan Nepomucino Goetz.
output: Juan Nepomucino Goetz (1793-1864) was a 19th-century Argentine poet and politician. Born in Buenos Aires, he studied law before beginning his career as a journalist, writing under the pseudonym "El Misionero". Goetz later joined the conservative Partido Unitario and served as Argentine President from 1852-1858. He promoted railways, education, and industrial development. After leaving office, Goetz wrote poems, plays, and political essays. He was elected to the Argentine National Congress in 1860.

input: Write a short biography of Juan Nepomucino Goetz.
output: Juan Nepomucino Goetz (1745-1810) was a Spanish painter and sculptor who trained under the artist Francisco Bayeu y Subias. Goetz is considered one of the most significant painters of the late 18th century in Spain, known for his classical and neoclassical works. His art depicted mythological and historical scenes, with a focus on the human form and beauty. Goetz is known for his large-scale frescoes, which covered entire rooms in palaces and churches. She studied at the Royal Academy of Music in London, performing at the Royal Opera House from 1961-1963. After marrying tenor Phillip Langridge, Te Kanawa spent most of the 1960s in Europe. In 1970, she became the first New Zealander to perform at the Metropolitan Opera in New York. She returned to New Zealand in 1974 and founded the New Zealand School of Singing. A cultural icon in her homeland, Te Kanawa became a Dame in 1990.
